channel.title: News
channel.description: Keep up to date with the latest news at the Department of Computer Science.

item.title: Autonomous Vehicles : Driving in the future (Paul Ralph's Interview on TV3 News and RadioLive)
item.description: Autonomous Vehicles : Driving in the future (Paul Ralph's Interview on TV3 News and RadioLive)

item.title: Gerald Weber says phone upgrades add to growing mountain of e-waste
item.description: Researcher says upgrades merely add to growing mountain of e-waste.

item.title: Applications open for Auckland Council's Graduate and Intern Programmes
item.description: We're looking for talented students and graduates for our 2016 Intern Programme and 2017 Graduate Programme.

item.title: New Zealand Programming Contest 2016
item.description: The New Zealand Programming Contest (NZPC) will be held on Saturday August 6th this year. This contest is in preparation for the Regional ACM Programming Contest, which will be held later on in the year.

item.title: Computer Science Student Success
item.description: Congratulations to Computer Science student Etuate Cocker, the first successful Computer Science PhD student to come from the Kingdom of Tonga.

item.title: Actigaze: New technology from Computer Science
item.description: Actigaze™, fast and reliable eye gaze interaction for the agility impaired, is a new technology developed by Dr Gerald Weber and Dr Christof Lutteroth (Computer Science) that has won the Health Tech Award 2016 at the New Zealand MedTech CoRE conference, held in June.

item.title: The artificial human body - by computer design
item.description: At this year’s Gibbons Lectures some of New Zealand’s leading scientists will discuss advances in medical science: medical applications of computer and information technologies.

item.title: ANZAC 2016 Programming League
item.description: We will host the ANZAC 2016 Programming League at University of Auckland again this year (selected Saturdays). The first one is scheduled for April 9th and is planned as a warm-up to prepare for future programming contests. No costs to the student.

item.title: Science subjects rate highly internationally
item.description: Science subjects at the University of Auckland are highly placed in this year’s QS World University Rankings with the University rated number one in the country in almost all subjects.

item.title: Game Development World Championship 2016
item.description: The Game Development World Championship is a worldwide contest where the winners win a trip to Northern Europe and gain recognition for their games from an international audience in the largest startup conference in the world, Slush, held in November 2016.

item.title: New multi-million dollar health research partnership
item.description: Technologies to deliver better health care and treatment for New Zealanders is the focus of a new multi-million dollar research partnership involving Orion Health, government, the health sector and the University of Auckland.

item.title: New multi-million dollar health research partnership
item.description: Technologies to deliver better health care and treatment for New Zealanders is the focus of a new multi-million dollar research partnership involving Orion Health, government, the health sector and the University of Auckland.

item.title: Professor Alexei Drummond - Youngest fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand
item.description: Professor Alexei Drummond interviewed by the New Zealand Herald, after becoming the youngest fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand.

item.title: Apple refusing to break iPhone encryption for the FBI
item.description: Dr Paul Ralph on the Paul Henry show and talks about Apple refusing to break iPhone encryption for the FBI.

item.title: Prof Clark Thomborson awarded Best International Superstar at the iSANZ Awards 2015
item.description: Professor Clark Thomborson was awarded the iSANZ 2015 Best International Superstar award

item.title: Department of Computer Science 2015 Prizegiving Winners
item.description: The Department of Computer 2015 Pricegiving Winners List

item.title: Mass surveillance and a crisis of social responsibility
item.description: A critic of mass surveillance and pioneering computer scientist whose work has contributed to reducing the risk of cyber-attack will give a public lecture at the University of Auckland next week.

item.title: Prof Alexei Drummond Elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand
item.description: Prof Alexei Drummond was elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society of New Zealand at the Annual General Meeting of the Society’s Academy in Wellington.

item.title: Dr Simone Linz Received a Fast-Start Grant From the Marsden Fund
item.description: Dr Simone Linz received a Fast-Start grant

item.title: Mobile phone addiction/compulsion (TV3 news tonight)
item.description: Dr Paul Ralph spoke TV3 news
